greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permanent of the circulant matrix whose first row is given by the binary expansion of n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = floor(log_2(2n))! for n in { A126646 }.
example: The circulant matrix for n = 23 = 10111_2 is
a(10) = 4 != a(12) = 2 although 10 = 1010_2 and 12 = 1100_2 have the same number of 0's and 1's.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 05 2019
